identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of Long-Term Efficacy and Safety of LIB003 in CVD or High Risk for CVD Patients Needing Further LDL-C Reduction
identificationModule.officialTitle: Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Efficacy and Safety of LIB003 in Patients With Cardiovascular Disease, or at High Risk for Cardiovascular Disease, on Stable Lipid-Lowering Therapy Requiring Additional LDL-C Reduction

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is to assess LDL-C reductions at Week 52 with monthly (Q4W \[≤31 days\]) dosing of LIB003 (lerodalcibep) 300 mg administered subcutaneously (SC) compared to placebo in patients with CVD, or at high risk for CVD, on a stable diet and oral LDL-C lowering drug therapy
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, Phase 3 study of 52 weeks duration.

Patients who fulfill the inclusion and exclusion criteria will be enrolled at up to 65 sites in the United States, Canada, Europe, South Africa, Asia, Australasia, and the Middle East. Patients will be randomized in a 2:1 ratio to LIB003 or placebo. The total study duration will be up to 63 weeks which includes up to a Screening Period and 52 weeks of study drug treatment. Following randomization patients will be dosed and seen in the clinic Q4W (≤31 days).

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Placebo-controlled, randomized 2:1 to Active or placebo

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: participants, study staff, investigator and sponsor blinded to treatment and lipid levels

primaryOutcomes.description: Percent change in LS mean from baseline compared to placebo in LDL-C level

primaryOutcomes.measure: mean LDL-C change at week 50 and 52
primaryOutcomes.description: Percent change in LS mean from baseline compared to placebo in LDL-C level at Weeks 50 and 52

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events as assessed by Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities as severe, moderate or mild after 52 weeks
secondaryOutcomes.description: Evaluation of Adverse Events based on MedRA based on ITT population
Percent change in LS mean from baseline compared to placebo in free PCSK9

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of patients achieving 2019 ESC/EAS LDL-C goals
secondaryOutcomes.description: To assess the effects of LIB003 on the percentage of patients achieving an LDL-C \<40 mg/dL, 55 mg/dL, \<70 mg/dL, and 100 mg/dL

locations.facility: G.B. Pant Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education & Research
Department of Medicine, Hadassah University Hospital
